Description: Here is a great guitar. Check the reviews and believe the hype. These are not just beautiful but high quality instruments that sound and play as good as any Gibson out there. This one is in great shape and comes with all the case candy. It does have the typical gibson/ epiphone finish cracks by the nut but are only in the finish not the wood ( see the last two pictures). I got it this way and haven't had any problems. I actually bought two like this and I'm selling this one because it's in better shape. I play the other one and was keeping this as a display but I have some unplanned bills so no reserve it is. It still has the protective plastic on the pickguard and gold body plate.Thanks for looking and please check out my other items for sale. Guitar stats are below... PRODUCT FEATURES Ltd. Ed. Joe Bonamassa 1958 "Amos" Korina Flying-V Outfit At A Glance     Based on Joe’s 1958 rare Flying V with Korina Body, 50’s style hardware     Critically acclaimed “PAF” style ProBucker™ Humbuckers     CTS™ Electronics and LockTone™ ABR-1 Tune-o-matic     Hand-signed certificate of authenticity and 50’s style hard case SPECIFICATIONS Body Material Korina (African Limba) Neck Material Korina (African Limba) Neck Profile Rounded-C 1958 profile Nut Artificial bone Neck Joint Glued In; Deep-set Neck Joint Truss Rod Adjustable Truss Rod Cover Gold Plated Metal: "Amos Arthur" engraving Scale Length 24.75" Fingerboard Material FSC™ Certified Blackwood Fingerboard Radius 12" Headstock Traditional Flying-V with raised "Epiphone" logo Neck Pickup Epiphone ProBucker-2™ Bridge Pickup Epiphone ProBucker-3™ Controls:   Epiphone 3-way pickup selector with Amber toggle cap Bridge Volume; CTS™ potentiometer Neck Volume; CTS™ potentiometer Master Tone; CTS™ potentiometer Binding None Frets 22; medium-jumbo Bridge LockTone™ ABR-1 Tune-o-matic Tailpiece String-Thru Body; 1958 "V" metal plate mounted with original-style Escutcheon nails Nut Width 1-11/16" Hardware Gold Pickguard 4-layer; (B/W/B/W) Output Jack Epiphone Heavy Duty 1/4" Output Jack Plate 4-layer; (w/B/W/B) Machine Heads Epiphone "Deluxe" Tuners with Tulip buttons; 18:1 ratio Knobs Black "Top Hat" knobs
Title: Epiphone Joe Bonamassa 1958 Amos Korina Flying-V Outfit W/ Hard Case No Reserve
